title: @Meddler Runic Echoes and Tiamat nerf

embed.description: The PBE has been updated! Continue reading for more information! ( Warning: PBE Content is tentative and iterative - what you see may not reflect what eventually gets pushed to live servers! Manage your expectations accordingly. ) ! * *: The PBE is a testing grounds for new, tentative, and sometimes radical changes.

body:
Runic Echoes 
Base damage lowered to 60 from 80

As for Runic Echoes I really don't understand why you would nerf it again. I mean Nidalee is strong (and gets her own nerfs) and Gragas isn't too bad either but imo it doesn't look like Runic Echoes is too strong. All other AP junglers aren't overbearing (Elise, Diana, Fiddle etc.) and I think Devourer is much more oppressive than Runic Echoes (doesn't mean it needs nerfs, the devourer jungler seem just stronger right now). So I really would love context here because this nerf hits champions, who don't deserve the nerf...


Tiamat
Build Path changed to [Long Sword + Long Sword + Rejuv Bead + 350g] from [Pickaxe + Rejuv. Bead + 175g] 
Attack damage lowered to 20 from 30
Unique Passive - Cleave added:
"UNIQUE Passive - Cleave: Basic attacks deal X to Y as bonus physical damage to enemies near the target on hit (enemies closest to the target take the most damage)."

Tiamat I actually really like right now. It doesn't cleave anymore, which makes it easier to freeze lane for example. But why would you reduce the AD on the item and give the cleave stuff back. I agree Titanic is too strong but definetely not Tiamat.

replies.body:
We're still seeing Runic Echoes be too effective on a range of junglers, a number of whom are building tank after finishing it. We're looking at nerfing its base damage as a result.

Tiamat's intended to offer AOE/wave clear as a core part of its identity. At present though it's not good enough in that regard, but too good at single target burst. We're taking some power from raw AD to restore the cleave passive as a result.

Tiamat change is going to be very impactful for champions who heavily relied on it's active to pull of their combos and win trades. I'm thinking of Talon, Riven, Kha'zix, maybe Wukong. I really liked the option to keep Tiamat as it is and upgrade it to Hydra whenever I feel like I needed the sustain. Have you taken these into consideration? Are there any other options for Tiamat?
Those champions and that situation are basically why it needs this change.
Now that Runic Echoes is noticeably weaker than Luden's, is it expected of AP junglers to sell it back in late game to get the "true" version of the item?
I always do that when I have the gold.

titanic is balanced for top lane you  dont see poppy or irelia rushing it cuz "omgz its OP!!" and your change  screws  bruisers instead of fixing the real problem ,  it becomes problematic on 2 jungle champions because of sated and their kit. Effectively titanic adds around 80 AD to your auto attacks from on-hit passive, which is being abused by shyvana's Q, master Yi's passive and sated devourer, yet you're nerfing the AD portion? That nerf doesnt target shyvana/Yi/sated devourer junglers at all. It only nerfs bruisers  even more,  guess top isnt dominated by adc's and tanks with broken base dmg enough right now  ...

I think I'm fine with Titanic giving less AD. The item right now lacks proper levers to make it appealing to bruisers. It's used more by other classes who want to negate their "squishiness" and then built upon with other items that add some damage (Sterak, DMP's on-hit) rather than health stackers. I mean, if they up it's health and shift it's on-hit effects to bonus health with proper percentages, the item would be fine and would properly reward champions who look to stack health rather than 2 damage items and 3 hybrid items. These changes are not about the champions who are OP with it, it's about the classes who use it. By reducing its AD, they only hit champions who make use of it. If they compensate the item with higher numbers on other parts of it, Yi and Shyvana who don't stack health exclusively, in contrast with say, Volibear, Darius, Garen, etc, won't get as much out of it again, but it might turn out to be appealing to those who it is meant for.

>We're still seeing Runic Echoes be too effective on a range of junglers, a number of whom are building tank after finishing it. 

Do you know why people are building Echoes into tank? It's because Cinderhulk just isn't up to par right now.

15% HP just isn't enough to make it an attractive item for late game bulk. Taking this item is always worse than taking early pressure, which is offered by RE. This basically means that if you're a jungler who can opt into RE it's always a better option than Cinder just because of Cinder requiring far too much HP to equal out its effect. That's before even mentioning Warrior which is honestly just terrible.

Basically I think maybe Echoes does need nerfs but it's also important to look at the weaker enchantments too. Especially when Cinderhulk is so weak it's being ignored by its [highest synergy user.](http://www.probuilds.net/champions/details/Sejuani)
